start up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if you start up a business, company etc, or it starts up, it begins to exist
start up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Tax breaks help new companies start up.
Jordan started up a band of his own.
start up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if an engine, car etc starts up, or you start it up, it begins working
start up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The driver got back into the car and started up.
Rory started up the engine and got the vehicle moving.
start up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a sound, activity, or event starts up, it begins to exist or happen
start up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The crickets had started up now that it was evening.
start up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: connected with starting a new business
start up.translation[2].definitions[0].d: a new small company or business, especially one whose work involves computers or the Internet
start up.translation[3].definitions[0].d: start-up costs, spending etc are connected with beginning and running a new business or new business activity
start up.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The company saw its profits drop because of the effect of start-up costs at a new plastics molding plant.
